onAttachedToWindow().Description: This is called when the view is attached to a window. At this point it has a Surface and will start drawing. Note that this function is guaranteed to be called before @B_android#view#View#onDraw_E@, however it may be called any time before the first onDraw -- including before or after @B_android#view#View#onMeasure_E@. If you override this method you must call through to the superclass implementation.
onAttachedToWindow().history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 17

onDetachedFromWindow().Description: This is called when the view is detached from a window. At this point it no longer has a surface for drawing. If you override this method you must call through to the superclass implementation.
onDetachedFromWindow().history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 17

getAccessibilityClassName().Description: Return the class name of this object to be used for accessibility purposes. Subclasses should only override this if they are implementing something that should be seen as a completely new class of view when used by accessibility, unrelated to the class it is deriving from. This is used to fill in @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo#setClassName_E@.
getAccessibilityClassName().history: Added in API level 23 Deprecated in API level 17

ClassDesc: It is recommended you use @B_android#widget#TextClock_E@ instead. Like AnalogClock, but digital.
